heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.5°C) and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%) and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 903 m), light levels (up 9914 lux), and pressure (up 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1034 m) and light levels (up 8730 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 903.4m lower than yesterday, 212.6m lower than the past week, 1033.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 737m and a high of 4780m, averaging 1490.4m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, the air will feel noticeably humid and uncomfortable and winds will be practically absent. Light to moderate rain is forecast, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
